description: Introduction to Angular, the enterprise-grade framework from Google. CLI, Modules, and Components.

slides.title: What is Angular?
slides.content:
# The Platform üõ°Ô∏è

Angular is a development platform for building mobile and desktop web applications.

- **Opinionated:** Includes everything (Router, Forms, HTTP).
- **TypeScript:** Built with TypeScript at its core.
- **Component-based:** Like React/Vue, but uses Classes with Decorators.

slides.title: Angular CLI
slides.content:
# The Power Tool üõ†Ô∏è

`ng` is the command line interface.

- `npm install -g @angular/cli`
- `ng new my-app`: Scaffold a project.
- `ng serve`: Run dev server.
- `ng generate component my-comp`: Create files automatically.

slides.title: Modules (NgModules)
slides.content:
# Modules üì¶

Unlike React/Vue, Angular organizes code into **Modules**.

Every app has at least a root module (`AppModule`). Modules group components, directives, and pipes.

(Note: Modern Angular also supports "Standalone Components" which skip modules, but modules are still foundational).

slides.title: Component Structure
slides.content:
# Anatomy üß¨

An Angular component consists of 3 parts:
1.  **Template:** HTML (`.component.html`)
2.  **Class:** TypeScript behavior (`.component.ts`)
3.  **Styles:** CSS/SCSS (`.component.css`)

Defined by the `@Component` decorator.

slides.title: Event Binding
slides.content:
# (Event) Binding üí•

To listen to events, use parentheses `()`.

```html
<button (click)="handleClick()">Click Me</button>
```

Easy to remember: **Bananas in a Box `[()]`** for two-way binding.

Summary
slides.content:
# Recap: Angular Basics üéì

The full framework.

- **CLI:** Generates code.
- **Modules:** Organize code.
- **Decorators:** `@Component` defines metadata.
- **Binding:** `{{ }}`, `[]`, `()`.
- **Directives:** `*ngIf`, `*ngFor`.
